member.name: P:PowerJson.Converters.XmlNode
member.summary: Gets an to serialize or instances. NOTICE: Deserialization is not supported at this moment.

remarks.para: Elements will be serialized as a dictionary which contains the following three items:

item.description: A dictionary entry with a name as the element qualified name surrounded with < and > and the value is its namespace URL.
A dictionary entry with a name as the attribute name prefixed with an "@" character, and the value of the attribute.
An array contains the child nodes of the element. The array can contain the following node types and child elements.
A text in the nodes array.
A dictionary containing one name-value pair in the nodes array.
A dictionary in the nodes array with a name "!" and a value as the content of the comment.

member.name: T:PowerJson.IJsonConverter
member.summary: Converts the member value being serialized or deserialized.

remarks.para: During deserialization, the JSON string is parsed and converted to primitive data. The data could be one of the following six types returned from the JSON Parser: , , , , and .
The method should be able to process the above six types, as well as the null value, and convert the value to match the type of the member being deserialized.

If the method returns a instead of null or the type of , the deserializer will firstly attempt to revert the primitive data to match that type, and then pass the reverted value to the method. By this means, the implementation of method does not have to cope with primitive data types.
To implement the method, keep in mind that the in the instance will always be primitive data.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonConverter.GetReversiveType(PowerJson.JsonItem)
member.summary: Returns the expected type from the primitive data in . If the returned type is not null, the deserializer will attempt to convert the of to match the returned type.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonConverter.SerializationConvert(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts the to a new value during serialization.

summary.para: Converts the to a new value during deserialization. The new value can be changed to a different type than the original value. This enables adapting various data types from deserialization.
The could be one of six primitive value types. For further information, refer to .

member.summary: A helper converter which implements the to convert between two specific types.
member.typeparam: The original type of the data being serialized.

member.name: T:PowerJson.JsonItem
member.summary: Represents a JSON name-value pair.

member.name: P:PowerJson.JsonItem.Renameable
member.summary: Gets whether the property of this instance can be changed.
member.remarks: During serialization, the of the property can be changed, and this value is true. During deserialization or serializing an item of an instance, the can not be changed, and this value is false.

member.name: P:PowerJson.JsonItem.Name
member.summary: The name of the item. During serialization, this property can be changed to serialize the member to another name. If the item is the object initially passed to the method (or its overloads), this value will be an empty string.
member.exception: This value is changed during deserialization or serializing an item of an instance.

member.name: P:PowerJson.JsonItem.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the item. The type and value of this property can be changed. The serializer and deserializer will take the changed value.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonItem.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates an instance of .

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonDeserializer.CreateObject(PowerJson.JsonDict,PowerJson.SerializationInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Deserializes an object.
member.param: The reflection cache of the type.
The data container. If this value is not null, deserialized members will be written to it. If null, new object will be created.

summary.para: An interface to intercept various aspects in JSON serialization and deserialization.
It is recommended to inherit from for easier implementation when possible.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonInterceptor.OnSerializing(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called before values are written out during serialization. If the method returns false, the object will not be serialized.
member.returns: Whether the object should be serialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonInterceptor.SerializeExtraValues(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called before the serialization is finished. Extra values can be returned and written to the serialized result.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonInterceptor.OnSerialized(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called after the object has been fully serialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonInterceptor.OnSerializing(System.Object,PowerJson.JsonItem)
member.summary: This method is called before serializing a field or a property. If the method returns false, the member will not be serialized.
member.returns: Whether the member should be serialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonInterceptor.OnDeserializing(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called between the object has been created and the values are filled during deserialization. This method provides an opportunity to initialize an object before deserialization.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonInterceptor.OnDeserialized(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called after the object has been fully deserialized. Data validation could be done onto the serialized object.

member.name: M:PowerJson.IJsonInterceptor.OnDeserializing(System.Object,PowerJson.JsonItem)
member.summary: This method is called before deserializing a field or a property. If the method returns false, the member will not be deserialized.
member.returns: Whether the member should be deserialized.

member.name: T:PowerJson.JsonInterceptor`1
member.summary: This is a default implementation of , which restricts the type of the object being serialized or deserialized. The default implementation does nothing and returns true for all OnSerializing or OnDeserializing methods.
member.typeparam: The type of the object being serialized or deserialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonInterceptor`1.OnSerializing(`0)
member.summary: This method is called before values are written out during serialization. If the method returns false, the object will not be serialized.
member.returns: Whether the object should be serialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonInterceptor`1.SerializeExtraValues(`0)
member.summary: This method is called before the serialization is finished. Extra values can be returned and written to the serialized result.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonInterceptor`1.OnSerialized(`0)
member.summary: This method is called after the object has been fully serialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonInterceptor`1.OnDeserializing(`0)
member.summary: This method is called between the object has been created and the values are filled during deserialization. This method provides an opportunity to initialize an object before deserialization.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonInterceptor`1.OnDeserialized(`0)
member.summary: This method is called after the object has been fully deserialized. Data validation could be done onto the serialized object.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonInterceptor`1.OnSerializing(`0,PowerJson.JsonItem)
member.summary: This method is called before serializing a field or a property. If the method returns false, the member will not be serialized.
member.returns: Whether the member should be serialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonInterceptor`1.OnDeserializing(`0,PowerJson.JsonItem)
member.summary: This method is called before deserializing a field or a property. If the method returns false, the member will not be deserialized.
member.returns: Whether the member should be deserialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.Reflection.CreateWrapperMethod``1(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Creates a wrapper delegate for the given method. The delegate should have a similar signature as the , except that an argument in inserted before the method arguments.
member.typeparam: A delegate definition. The first argument of the delegate will be used to invoke the method.
member.param: The method to be converted to the delegate.
member.returns: The wrapper delegate to invoke the method.

example.code: delegate void MyAddMethod (IEnumerable target, object value); Reflection.CreateWrapperMethod<MyAddMethod> (typeof(List<string>).GetMethod("Add"));

The types of method arguments. Null value in the array means the corresponding argument can be any type.
member.returns: The method matches the name and argument types.

member.summary: This method is called to get the for the type. If no converter, null should be returned. The converter can be set via .
member.param: The type to be checked for .

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonReflectionController.GetCollectionContainerName(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the name of the collection container for customized types which implement and have extra members to be serialized.
member.param: The which implements and contains extra members to be serialized.
member.returns: The name of the collection container. If null is returned, no container will be created.
member.remarks: By default, the serializer serializes types which implement interface as JSON arrays. Members of the type will be ignored. And so to the types which implements . To serialize those members, return a non-empty name and the members will be serialized into a field named returned by this method.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonReflectionController.IsMemberSerializable(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,PowerJson.IMemberInfo)
member.summary: Returns whether the specific member is serializable. This value can be set via and . If true is returned, the member will always get serialized. If false is returned, the member will be excluded from serialization. If null is returned, the serialization of the member will be determined by the settings in .
member.returns: True is returned if the member is serializable, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonReflectionController.IsMemberDeserializable(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,PowerJson.IMemberInfo)
member.summary: Gets whether a field or a property is deserializable. If false is returned, the member will be excluded from deserialization. By default, writable fields or properties are deserializable. The value can be set via .
member.returns: True is returned if the member is serializable, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonReflectionController.GetSerializedNames(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: This method returns possible names for corresponding types of a field or a property. This enables polymorphic serialization and deserialization for abstract classes, interfaces, or object types, with predetermined concrete types. If polymorphic serialization is not used, null or an empty could be returned. The names can be set via .
member.param: The of the field or property.
member.returns: The dictionary contains types and their corresponding names.
member.exception: The type does not derive from the member type.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonReflectionController.GetNonSerializedValues(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: This method returns a series of values that will not be serialized for a field or a property. When the value of the member matches those values, it will not be serialized. If all values can be serialized, null should be returned. The value can be set via .
member.param: The of the field or property.
member.returns: The values which are not serialized for .

member.summary: This method returns the to convert values for a field or a property during serialization and deserialization. If no converter is used, null can be returned. The converter can be set via .
member.param: The of the field or property.

member.name: M:PowerJson.DefaultReflectionController.GetTypeAlias(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the type alias which can be used to determine derived types for abstract types, interface types or the type during deserialization.

member.name: M:PowerJson.DefaultReflectionController.IsAlwaysDeserializable(System.Type)
member.summary: This method is called before the constructor of a type is built for deserialization to detect whether the type is deserializable. When this method returns true, the type can be deserialized regardless it is a non-public type. Public types are always deserializable and not affected by the value returned from this method. If the type contains generic parameters (for generic types) or an element type (for array types), the parameters and element types will be checked first.
member.returns: Whether the type can be deserialized even if it is a non-public type.

member.summary: This method is called to get the for the type. If no interceptor, null should be returned.

If true is returned, the member will always get serialized. If null is returned, the serialization of the member will be determined by the settings in .
member.returns: False is returned if the member is private, otherwise, null is returned.

member.name: T:PowerJson.IReflectionController
member.summary: The controller interface to control type reflections for serialization and deserialization.

remarks.para: The interface works in the reflection phase. Its methods are executed typically once and the result will be cached. Consequently, changes occur after the reflection phase will not take effect.
It is recommended to inherit from or .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty, has the specified initial capacity, and uses the default equality comparer for the key type.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty, has the default initial capacity, and uses the default equality comparer for the key type.

member.name: M:PowerJson.SafeDictionary`2.Clear
member.summary: Clears all items.

member.name: M:PowerJson.SafeDictionary`2.TryGetValue(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get.

When this method returns, contains the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: Returns true if the dictionary contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:PowerJson.SafeDictionary`2.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of key/value pairs contained in the dictionary.

member.name: P:PowerJson.SafeDictionary`2.Item(`0)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get or set.
member.returns: The value associated with the specified key. If the specified key is not found, a get operation throws a , and a set operation creates a new element with the specified key.

member.summary: Removes specific key from the dictionary.

member.name: T:PowerJson.JsonSerializableAttribute
member.summary: Indicates whether non-public classes, structs, fields or properties could be serialized and deserialized.

member.summary: Indicates whether a field or property should be included in serialization. To control whether a field or property should be deserialized, use the .

member.summary: Indicates the name and data type of a field or property. The same field or property with multiple can have various names mapped to various types.

member.summary: The type of interceptor. The instance of the type should implement . During serialization and deserialization, an instance of will be created to process values of the object being serialized or deserialized.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonInterceptorAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Marks a class or a struct to be processed by an .
member.exception: The exception will be thrown if the type does not implements .

member.name: T:PowerJson.JsonConverterAttribute
member.summary: Controls data conversion in serialization and deserialization.

remarks.para: This attribute can be applied to types or type members.
If it is applied to types, the converter will be used in all instances of the type, each property or field that has that data type will use the converter prior to serialization or deserialization.
If both the type member and the type has applied this attribute, the attribute on the type member will have a higher precedence.

summary.para: The type of converter to convert string to object. The type should implement .
During serialization and deserialization, an instance of will be used to convert values between their original type and target type.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonConverterAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Marks the value of a field or a property to be converted by an .
member.exception: Exception can be thrown if the type does not implements .

member.name: T:PowerJson.JsonItemConverterAttribute
member.summary: Controls data conversion of items in serialization and deserialization.

summary.para: The type of converter to convert string to object. The type should implement .
During serialization and deserialization, an instance of will be used to convert values between their original type and target type.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonItemConverterAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Marks the item value of a field or a property to be converted by an .
member.exception: Exception can be thrown if the type does not implements .

member.name: T:PowerJson.JsonCollectionAttribute
member.summary: Denotes a type which implements should be serialized with its members and items being placed to a field named by this attribute.

member.summary: Gets the name of the container.

member.name: M:PowerJson.JsonCollectionAttribute.#ctor(System.String)

member.name: T:PowerJson.SerializationInfo
member.summary: An overridden copy of .

member.name: M:PowerJson.SerializationInfo.Instantiate
member.summary: Creates an instance of the type by calling its parameterless constructor.
member.exception: The type has no constructor, or constructor is not publicly visible, or the constructor takes any argument.

member.name: T:PowerJson.SerializationManager
member.summary: A class controls special serialization for specified types and members.

remarks.para: This class can be used to control serialization and deserialization for specified types and members.
The overriding methods, such as , , etc., must be called before serialization or deserialization. Otherwise, inconsistent serialization results may occur between types.

member.name: P:PowerJson.SerializationManager.ReflectionController
member.summary: Returns the currently used by the .

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.UseOptimizedDatasetSchema
member.summary: Uses the optimized fast Dataset Schema format (default = True)

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.UseFastGuid
member.summary: Uses the fast GUID format (default = false)

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.SerializeNullValues
member.summary: Serializes null values to the output (default = True)

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.SerializeStaticMembers
member.summary: Serializes static fields or properties into the output (default = false).

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.SerializeEmptyCollections
member.summary: Serializes arrays, collections, lists or dictionaries with no element (default = true).
member.remarks: If the collection is the root object, it is not affected by this setting. Byte arrays are not affected by this setting either.

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.UseUniversalTime
member.summary: Use the UTC date format (default = false)

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.SerializeReadOnlyProperties
member.summary: Shows the read-only properties of types in the output (default = False). has higher precedence than this setting.

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.SerializeReadOnlyFields
member.summary: Shows the read-only fields of types in the output (default = False). has higher precedence than this setting.

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.EnableAnonymousTypes
member.summary: Anonymous types have read only properties

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.UseExtensions
member.summary: Enables JSON extensions $type, $i (default = True). This setting must be set to true if circular reference detection is required.

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.UseEscapedUnicode
member.summary: Use escaped Unicode i.e. \uXXXX format for non ASCII characters (default = false)

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.KVStyleStringDictionary
member.summary: Outputs string key dictionaries as "k"/"v" format (default = False)

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.UseValuesOfEnums
member.summary: Outputs Enum values instead of names (default = False).

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.ParametricConstructorOverride
member.summary:
If you have parametric and no default constructor for you classes (default = False)
IMPORTANT NOTE : If True then all initial values within the class will be ignored and will be not set. In this case, you can use to assign an to initialize the object.

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.DateTimeMilliseconds
member.summary: Serializes DateTime milliseconds i.e. yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.nnn (default = false)

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.SerializerMaxDepth
member.summary: Maximum depth for circular references in inline mode (default = 20)

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.InlineCircularReferences
member.summary: Inlines circular or already seen objects instead of replacement with $i (default = False)

member.name: P:PowerJson.SerializationManager.NamingConvention
member.summary: Controls the case of serialized field names.

member.name: F:PowerJson.SerializationManager.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance.

member.name: M:PowerJson.SerializationManager.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .
member.remarks: The will be initialized to a new instance of .

member.summary: Creates a new instance of with a specific .
member.param: The controller to control object reflections before serialization.

member.summary: Clears all cached override information.

member.summary: Loads the serialization information into the overrides dictionary and return the information.
member.param: The which holds the serialization information.

member.name: M:PowerJson.SerializationManager.Override``1(PowerJson.TypeOverride)
member.summary: Overrides reflection result with for the type. If the type is already overridden, either automatically or manually, the will merged into the existing reflected info.
member.param: The override info of the type.

member.name: M:PowerJson.SerializationManager.Override``1(PowerJson.TypeOverride,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overrides reflection result with for the type.
member.param: The override info of the type.
If this value is true, the reflection engine will reflect the type again and apply the , otherwise, is merged into the existing reflection cache.

member.name: M:PowerJson.SerializationManager.Override(System.Type,PowerJson.TypeOverride,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overrides reflection result with for the specific type and optionally purge existing overrides.
member.param: The override info of the type.
If this value is true, the reflection engine will reflect the type again and apply the , otherwise, is merged into the existing reflection cache.

remarks.para: At this moment, the override only affects the registered type.
If a class has its subclasses, the override will not be applied to its subclasses.

member.exception: No member is found for a in .

member.name: M:PowerJson.SerializationManager.OverrideInterceptor``1(PowerJson.IJsonInterceptor)

summary.para: Assigns an to process a specific type.
This is a simplified version of method replacing the of a type.

member.typeparam: The type to be processed by the interceptor.
member.param: The interceptor to intercept the serialization and deserialization.
member.remarks: If the type has already gotten an , the new will replace it. If the new interceptor is null, existing interceptor will be removed from the type.

member.name: M:PowerJson.SerializationManager.OverrideTypeAlias``1(System.String)

summary.para: Assigns an alias for a specific type.
This is a simplified version of method replacing the of a type.

member.remarks: If the type has already gotten an alias, the new alias will replace it. If the new alias is null, existing alias will be removed.

member.param: The converter to convert instances of type before the serialization and deserialization.
member.remarks: If the type has already gotten an , the new will replace it. If the new converter is null, existing converter will be removed from the type.

member.name: M:PowerJson.SerializationManager.OverrideEnumValueNames``1(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Assigns new name mapping for an Enum type .
member.param: The value mapper for the enum type . The key of the dictionary is the original name of the enum value to be overridden, the value is the new serialized name to be specified to the value.

member.name: T:PowerJson.MemberOverride
member.summary: Contains reflection override settings for a member.

member.name: P:PowerJson.MemberOverride.MemberName
member.summary: Gets the name of the overridden member.

member.name: P:PowerJson.MemberOverride.SerializedName
member.summary: Gets or sets the serialized name for the member.

member.name: P:PowerJson.MemberOverride.TypedNames
member.summary: Gets the polymorphic serialization for the member. The item key is the type and the item value is the serialized name corresponding to the type. The type should derive from the type of the member.

member.name: P:PowerJson.MemberOverride.Serializable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the member is always serialized (true), never serialized (false) or compliant to the existing behavior (null).

member.name: P:PowerJson.MemberOverride.Deserializable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the member can be deserialized (true), never deserialized (false) or compliant to the existing behavior (null).

member.name: P:PowerJson.MemberOverride.NonSerializedValues
member.summary: Gets the values of the member that should not be serialized.

member.name: P:PowerJson.MemberOverride.Converter
member.summary: Gets or sets the for the member.
member.remarks: If the member has a converter before the override, and the value of this converter is null, existing converter will be removed after the override.

member.name: P:PowerJson.MemberOverride.ItemConverter
member.summary: Gets or sets the for the item of an member.
member.remarks: If the member has an item converter before the override, and the value of this converter is null, existing converter will be removed after the override.
